Hillsdale College K-12 Classical Education
August 15 at 9:00 AM ·

Napoleon Bonaparte was a French statesman and military leader who became famous as a commander during the French Revolution. Napoleon dominated Europe for over a decade while leading France against a series of coalitions during the Napoleonic Wars. He won many of those wars which allowed him to build a large empire that ruled over much of continental Europe before its collapse in 1815. He is considered one of the greatest commanders in history, and his wars are studied at military schools worldwide. Napoleon's political and cultural legacy has made him one of the most celebrated and controversial leaders in human history.
